item.title: Civilization 7 Update 1.1.0 Released, Full Patch Notes Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/civilization-7-update-110-patch-notes

Firaxis and 2K have released Civilization 7 Update 1.1.0, the game's first major update, and it's got plenty of improvements and balance tweaks to hopefully improve your experience with the game.

First up, Firaxis says it's made some tweaks to the Geographic Society victory condition, improving "how this victory feels and plays". It should no longer be quite as easy to "breeze through this path when no other players are aiming for this victory".

Changes to this effect include Explorer units costing more, fewer Exploration Age artifacts spawning per continent, and the ability to study Natural Wonders for Artifacts, plus more.

There are, of course, tons of other changes to both the PC and console versions of Civilization 7. On the PC side, these changes include improvements to the game's AI and various systems, as well as improvements for its UI.

Console changes are also pretty extensive, with many smaller changes to UI, gameplay systems, and more. You can check out the full patch notes for Civilization 7 Update 1.1.0 right here.

Whether or not this is enough to placate players who still feel angry about Civilization 7's launch remains to be seen. Last month, Firaxis promised to address players' common criticisms of the game, so let's hope the UI improvements in this update are a good start, at least.

The first half of Civilization 7's inaugural paid DLC pack has gone live as part of this update as well, and it includes a new Leader, two new Civilizations, and new Natural Wonders. Again, though, you will have to pay to enjoy that stuff.

Civilization 7 is the latest mainline installment in the Civilization series of turn-based strategy games. It includes a new Age system to more clearly demarcate time periods, as well as changes to city-building, diplomacy, and more.

You can check Civilization 7 out right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch. A VR version of the game is also on the way exclusively for Meta Quest 3.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Dead by Daylight to Lose Hellraiser's Cenobite Next Month
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/dead-by-daylight-hellraiser-chapter-leaving

Behaviour Interactive has announced that Dead by Daylight will soon lose one of its killers in the form of Pinhead, the iconic Cenobite villain from Clive Barker's horror movie Hellraiser.

In a post on its website, Behaviour says that since Dead by Daylight is a live service game, it's prone to "unexpected changes", and that the loss of the game's Hellraiser Chapter, which includes Pinhead and a number of other items, is one such change.

You'll no longer be able to purchase Pinhead or any of the associated cosmetics starting from April 4th at 11am Eastern (that's 8am Pacific and around 4pm GMT).

If you already happen to own the Cenobite Chapter, you'll still be able to access and play as Pinhead, and you'll also still retain access to your cosmetics and perks.

However, if you don't already own the Chapter, Pinhead's associated perks will be released to the general perk pool and will undergo a name change, with associated charms and achievements also being updated to reflect said change.

This isn't the first time characters from a major horror franchise have departed Dead by Daylight; back in 2021, the Demogorgon and other Stranger Things characters were removed from the game's store.

Two years later, Behaviour reintroduced Stranger Things characters and cosmetics to Dead by Daylight, so hey - maybe there's hope for Pinhead and the Chatterer yet. Let's hope so.

Pinhead isn't leaving Dead by Daylight until April, so if you do happen to want to pick up his Chapter and you haven't already done so, Behaviour is holding a sale right now that slashes 50% off the game's Hellraiser stuff.

You can check out Dead by Daylight right now on PC, PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo Switch, and the Cenobite Chapter is still available until April 4th across all of these platforms as well.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: BAFTA Games Awards 2025 Nominees Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/bafta-games-awards-2025-nominees

BAFTA has revealed the nominees for its yearly Games Awards, and a number of games are up for awards in categories like Artistic Achievement, Evolving Game, and New Intellectual Property.

Actors are also honored in a similar manner to the BAFTA movie awards, including Performer in a Leading Role and Supporting Role. Let's take a look at the nominees this year!

  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Helldivers 2
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

Animation

  • Astro Bot
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Lego Horizon Adventures
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!
  • Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2

Artistic Achievement

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Harold Halibut
  • Neva
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Still Wakes the Deep

Audio Achievement

  • Animal Well
  • Astro Bot
  • Helldivers 2
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Star Wars Outlaws
  • Still Wakes the Deep

British Game

  • A Highland Song
  • Lego Horizon Adventures
  • Paper Trail
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Still Wakes the Deep
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!

Debut Game

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro
  • Pacific Drive
  • Tales of Kenzera: Zau
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!
  • The Plucky Squire

Evolving Game

  • Diablo 4
  • Final Fantasy XIV Online
  • No Man's Sky
  • Sea of Thieves
  • Vampire Survivors
  • World of Warcraft

Family

  • Astro Bot
  • Cat Quest 3
  • Lego Horizon Adventures
  • Little Kitty, Big City
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • The Plucky Squire

Game Beyond Entertainment

  • Botany Manor
  • Kind Words 2
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Tales of Kenzera: Zau
  • Tetris Forever
  • Vampire Therapist

Game Design

  • Animal Well
  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Helldivers 2
  • Tactical Breach Wizards
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

Multiplayer

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Helldivers 2
  • Lego Horizon Adventures
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • Tekken 8
  • Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2

Music

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Helldivers 2
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Star Wars Outlaws

Narrative

  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Still Wakes the Deep

New Intellectual Property

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Still Wakes the Deep
  • Thank Goodness You're Here!

Performer in a Leading Role

  • Alec Newman (Still Wakes the Deep)
  • Humberly González (Star Wars Outlaws)
  • Isabella Inchbald (Indika)
  • Luke Roberts (Silent Hill 2)
  • Melina Juergens (Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2)
  • Y'lan Noel (Call of Duty: Black Ops 6)

Performer in a Supporting Role

  • Abbi Greenland and Helen Goalen (Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2)
  • Aldís Amah Hamilton (Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2)
  • Jon Blyth (Thank Goodness You're Here!)
  • Karen Dunbar (Still Wakes the Deep)
  • Matt Berry (Thank Goodness You're Here!)
  • Michael Abubakar (Still Wakes the Deep)

Technical Achievement

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Tiny Glade
  • Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2

Those are all of your BAFTA Games Awards 2025 nominees! There are a few favorites, including some we've already seen at last year's Game Awards, as well as some unexpected nods. We'll have to wait and see who wins!
